intro: Acer obtusatum var. lobatum, commonly known as the Japanese maple or lobed maple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. Its flowers are small and green, appearing before the leaves in early spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
